oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gatekeepers changing consumers' behaviour in energy consumption
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kaskinen, Tuuli
Kuittinen, Outi
Neuvonen, Aleksi
Mokka, Roope
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Environmental aspects
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Changing people's behaviour and reducing energy consumption has proved to be more difficult than attitudes or technical possibilities would imply. In this paper we discuss how to intervene the individual decisions that significantly determine energy consumption. When analysing energy-relevant decisions, we have noticed that the scale of energy-relevant decisions varies greatly in accordance with the situation of life. There are once-in-a-lifetime decisions (e.g. choosing the family home) that set the energy consumption, at a relatively fixed level, for years to come.
